original_title: CSE to conduct a full day of trading from the Disaster Recovery site
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s stock trading will be conducted through its Disaster Recovery site using Automated Trading System Disaster Recovery Solution on June 23, 2023, Colombo Stock Exchange said on Thursday.
“The exercise will be an industry wide activity with the participation of all stakeholders,” CSE in a statement said.
“This is to ensure the preparedness of all participants to meet the recovery needs of the industry.”
During the trading hours all trading activities and Central Depository Services (CDS) operations will be switched over to the remote site.

The failover during trading hours to the Disaster Recovery site is an exercise that is being carried out to demonstrate the robustness of system infrastructure and the preparedness of the CSE and all market participants in the event of a catastrophic incident.

The exercise indicates that the CSE’s and Industry’s Business Continuity process is capable and that the disaster recovery facility is fully functional and operational and has the ability of carrying out all system critical processes within the span of a few hours following a disaster.
The disaster recovery exercise is expected to be carried out annually, to ensure the continued maintenance of the expected standard, CSE said. (Colombo/ June 23/2023)
